hypothesis_content.title: CPI Surprise Amplification in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When headline CPI prints a surprise move of ≥0.3% vs. consensus during a NEUTRAL regime, the initial 30-minute price move in BTC will be amplified by 1.8-2.2x over the following 4-6 hours as institutional flows and retail FOMO converge.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack strong directional bias, making them prone to overreaction to fundamental catalysts. The recent CPI surprise (2.7% vs expectations) already showed amplification potential. Institutional desks often wait for confirmation of retail reaction before deploying larger orders, creating a secondary wave.
entry_conditions: CPI release shows ≥0.3% deviation from consensus (up or down)
BTC 30-minute post-release move exceeds 1.5% in direction of surprise
Cumulative volume delta (CVD) on major exchanges confirms institutional participation (≥$50M net flow in direction)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 6-hour move reaches 2.2x the initial 30-minute move OR price reaches key technical level (previous high/low, VWAP anchor)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses beyond 50% of initial 30-minute move within 2 hours

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If post-CPI moves consistently fail to extend beyond 1.5x initial reaction over 6 hours across 3 consecutive events, or if reversal occurs >70% of the time within 2 hours.
